title: Huawei Mate 10 renders show the return of the home button | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: OnLeaks and Compareraja

**Fresh renders of the upcoming Huawei Mate 10 have have cropped up online,
suggesting the new phablet-sized handset from the Chinese tech firm could have
a physical front-facing home button and fingerprint scanner.**

The renders come courtesy of self-proclaimed tech specs leaker and Twitter
user OnLeaks who shared the render with Indian tech site
[_Compareraja_](https://www.compareraja.in/blog/exclusive-leak-huawei-
mate-10/). OnLeaks is generally considered to be relatively reliable when it
comes to leaking accurate smartphone renders and specifications.

> And now, ur very 1st look at
[#HuaweiMate10](https://twitter.com/hashtag/HuaweiMate10?src=hash) (360 video
+ dimensions based upon factory CAD) on behalf of
[@compareraja](https://twitter.com/compareraja) <https://t.co/SncijNHZah>
[pic.twitter.com/EfEVmPHkzQ](https://t.co/EfEVmPHkzQ)

>

> — Steve H. (@OnLeaks) [September 6,
2017](https://twitter.com/OnLeaks/status/905248602100027392)

Based on the renders, not a lot appears to have changed from the [Huawei Mate
9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/huawei-mate-9) other than the
positioning of the fingerprint scanner on the front of the phone rather than
the rear. A dual lens rear camera array is present and correct, likely
sporting Leica tech, like its predecessor and the [Huawei
P10](https://www.trustedreviews.com/g00/reviews/huawei-p10?i10c.referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.co.uk%2F).
And the Mate 10 will retain a 3.5mm audio jack, while charging and data
transfer will be done through a USB Type-C port.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

The display is set to measure in at 5.9 inches and the handset’s chassis is
expected to have an all glass back, which will likely give it a premium feel
but also make it a fingerprint magnet. With the addition of a physical front-
mounted home button, the Mate 10 could stretch to rather large dimensions,
potentially making it a phone that shuns single handed operation.

Other specifications are open to further speculation, but it would be a safe
bet to predict the Mate 10 will have Huawei’s latest Kirin 970 system-on-a-
chip at its heart paired with 6GB of RAM and on board storage starting at
64GB; the renders suggest that there’s no microSD slot to allow for more
storage space to be added.

The [Huawei Mate 10 is set to be officially revealed on October
16](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/huawei-mate-10-3260270) in Munich,
Germany.
